lines.text: [Chris Lecce is angry with Gina Garrett because of her interference in the stakeout]

If this assignment gets blown, I want to go on record right now, that this is the most stupid, dimwitted, idiotic, moronic piece of putrefied garbage that I have ever in my entire professional career, ever had the displeasure of being involved with.
[Gina Garrett asks Bill Reimers to shave his mustache to look younger]
I don't think you understand the relationship a man has with his facial hair.
So when are we inviting them over for drinks?
Uh, Bill.
Yes, Chris?
Did I just hear you ask me to invite the neighbors over for drinks? The very people we are here to stake out?
Why, no Chris, I'd never think of such a thing.
Good to know Bill!
[Chris and Bill have had enough of Gina]
Here is my badge, here is my gun, and here is me, *leaving*!
[Maria and Chris are arguing, Maria meanwhile is holding a TV in her arms]
Now, Maria let's go over something. I came home last night.
[nods crazily]
We had sex.
[nods crazily]
Then I woke up and went to work like I do every morning. Now did I forget something?
[drops the TV causing it to smash]
[looks down at the floor with an unbelievable expression on his face]
I'm leaving. And when I come back, I want you gone.

[to Maria who's running off]
All right, all right! I'll marry you.

[smiles wickedly and comes back to Chris and then plugs him in the stomach with her fist!]
Life is just too short.
[doubled over gives a weak cough]
[Bill Reimers and Chris Lecce call to Archie (a dog) who is chasing a neighbour's cat - Archie takes no notice]
Come back here!
Oh stick 'em Archie. Eat the cat!
Cover me! I'm taking a bath.
Your cover is you're renting the judge's house for a month of vacation.
As what?... friends or lovers?
I've had this moustache for thirteen years. How long have you had yours?

[On seeing their suspect]
I think we should arrest him for what he's wearing!
I usually wait about three days before introducing myself to the people I'm staking out!
I'll miss you guys, a little. I am going to sue for custody, though.

[Pointing to Bill]
Of him? Take him, he irritates the hell out of me.
This guy's got a gun. Not a lawyer.
